comments:
Hello

When start Ant on a build.xml in one of my projects I get the following error
when right clicking on the build.xml file and pressing "Run Ant..." (The problem
appears on the Targets tab):
Could not find one or more classes: "org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException".
Please check the Ant classpath.

The classpath, however, seems to be correct. Note: All worked just fine using M4.

Here's the generated log entry:

!SESSION Nov 27, 2003 05:12:52.619 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_CH
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data
d:\files\eclipse\workspace -install file:C:/eclipse/drops/eclipse-SDK-3.0M5/eclipse/

Christian can you please provide the details of your Ant runtime classpath?
Is it a custom classpath or a default classpath?
Does restore defaults correct the problem?

Thank you, Darin, for your fast reply.

Restoring the defaults fixed my problem.

However, only if I don't use German umlauts (such as ?, ?, ?) within comments of
a build.xml. If I do use umlauts I get another error in the Targets tab: "UTF-8
encoding of character 0x001aeb20 can't be converted to Unicode."

However, I don't necessarily need German umlauts in comments and thus this bug
can be closed.

Christian when you get a chance can you please open a different bug report 
outlining the problem with the umlauts and attach a simple build file that 
exhibits the problem. Thanks.
